newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Asia Naphtha/Mogas-Firm naphtha draws arb cargoes.
newsitem.headline: Asia Naphtha/Mogas-Firm naphtha draws arb cargoes.

text.p: Naphtha edged up on Wednesday on crude's rebound while gasoline was steady in lacklustre dealings, traders said.
The stronger naphtha prices in Asia have opened up the arbitrage window for Algerian and Suez cargoes, traders said.
But naphtha trade was stymied as traders eyed Mideast term negotiations.

Kuwait Petroleum Corp's (KPC) term talks in London for one-year supplies of over two million tonnes of paraffinic naphtha starting in August, traders said the offer was indicated at $20 per tonne over Mideast naphtha spot quotes, fob.
But they said one South Korean firm bid at a $13.50, while other Asian buyers have yet to indicate their buying idea.
In ADNOC term talks, buyers were standing firm at a $19-$20 premium while ADNOC had lowered its offer to $21.75 from $22.50.
Fresh gasoline demand from Indonesia has yet to emerge, limiting regional demand to India's tender closing June 12 and valid for a day.

Pakistan's Ministry of Petroleum and Natural Resources bought from Mideast trader Star Energy, one 25,000 tonne cargo of 80-octane 0.15 grammes per litre motor gasoline for July delivery at around $25 per tonne over Mideast naphtha quotes,
c+f Pakistan -- almost on par with its last purchase of two cargoes in May at a $25.43 premium.
But its optional purchase for September delivery from U.K.-based trader Hascombe was much firmer at a premium of around $29.00.
MTH FOB SIN BUY/SELL PREV BUY/SELL
